meanings.definition: A straight line that a curve approaches but never meets.
meanings.sent1: The graph of the function gets closer and closer to the asymptote but never touches it.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician drew an asymptote to show where the curve would never cross.
meanings.sent3: Why did the curve break up with the asymptote? They were just never meant to meet!
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like an asymptote, always getting closer but never quite reaching each other.
meanings.sent5: The idea of an asymptote is like a mirage in the desert, always visible but never attainable.

meanings.definition: A curve that continually approaches a given line but does not meet it at any finite distance.
meanings.sent1: The graph of the function shows the curve getting closer and closer to the asymptote.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained how the curve would never actually touch the asymptote.
meanings.sent3: Why did the curve invite the asymptote to the party? They knew they would never meet in the end!
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like an asymptote, always dancing around each other but never connecting.
meanings.sent5: The concept of an asymptote is like a distant star, always visible but forever out of reach.
